content: As promised, here is the PDF document showing chapters 2008/09 to 2016 (still have the summary pages to complete):https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M8z4M4oV4WC_aIGWkn-tO_T7Nkllj47C/view?usp=sharingPlease leave comments, feedback and suggestions for improvement in this thread.  The current thread for the book is:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5475400.0I will strive to finish the chapters for 2017 to 30th June 2024 (nearly 50% complete) by this summer.  Please show generosity and donate to help me complete the Bitcoin History 2008-2024 book by 12th September 2024:$BTC bc1qktyzg2atx5paka2x64pxdwg54u7m2yn3cu2qxy$LTC ltc1qz8jqkhy264q3mdjkjzsve7er25qdnmmvxt96lr$ETH 0x125288bAf499e26259f8E2aC6FC5fE1491aBa9c2$DOGE DRj7PWEz5zxHc5ptkTBapKjCrxQU75CB6q$XRP r9LbXGJ9HCdwvAhKWJJLihSd8612xHybv7With sufficient help, I know the book will be completed by September 2024.  Thank you in advance for your support and feedback.UPDATE: 18/04/2024Great news!I'm still making constructive progress.  Currently I'm completing chapter 2019, which I hope will be finished within the next week.  The screenshots are thumbnails of pages 178 to 214 covering January 2017 to March 2019:Please support the book if you can.  There is only myself who has spent over one year writing it.  P.S. If you donate at least US$10, you will have your name/alias listed in the book!

comments.author: SickDayIn
comments.body: I'm about 1/4 of the way through this book and I definitely agree that it is important that anyone involved in Bitcoin has a full understanding of it's origin and associated timelines. I have been involved in Bitcoin for a long time and thought I was very familiar with key events, but I wanted to share a snippet of some new things that I learnt and took notes on, so others can read it and hopefully be inspired to read the book themselves:(1) Satoshi disappeared from BitcoinTalk forum in December 2010, ~2-3 days after an article was released by PC world on WikiLeaks potentially adopting BTC as an option for donations (Page 77).(2) Gavin Anderson had accepted to speak at the CIA on Bitcoin, and told Satoshi by email and BitcoinTalk forum about this on 27th April 2011. Satoshi's last communication was earlier that week on 23rd April 2011 to Gavin (Page 86). (3) I had no idea the role Silk Road played in the price increase for Bitcoin from $1 USD in Feb 2011 to $31.91 in June 2011.(4) The BTC fiat price increased by 41,683% in 2010.(5) I completely forgot about the "value overflow incident" for Bitcoin code CVE-2010-5139 which due to a bug created 92 billion BTC (Page 73), but was removed with a soft fork.So many lessons from reading this, thank you.
